text: Waci (also spelled Ouatchi) is a Gbe language of Togo and Benin. It is part of a dialect continuum which also includes Ewe and Mina also known as GÉ›n. It is scattered in an area Capo designates as Ewe speaking. ==References== Category:Languages of Benin Category:Languages of Togo Category:Niger-Congo languages
title: Waci language
